info.description:
Transit Gateway Network Manager (Network Manager) enables you to create a global network, in which you can monitor your AWS and on-premises networks that are built around transit gateways.

The Network Manager APIs are supported in the US West (Oregon) Region only. You must specify the us-west-2 Region in all requests made to Network Manager.
info.title: AWS Network Manager

parameters.description: The IDs of one or more global networks. The maximum is 10.
parameters.name: globalNetworkIds

get.description: Describes one or more global networks. By default, all global networks are described. To describe the objects in your global network, you must use the appropriate Get* action. For example, to list the transit gateways in your global network, use GetTransitGatewayRegistrations.

Description.description:
A description of the global network.

Length Constraints: Maximum length of 256 characters.

Tags.description: The tags to apply to the resource during creation.

post.description: Creates a new, empty global network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

delete.description: Deletes an existing global network. You must first delete all global network objects (devices, links, and sites) and deregister all transit gateways.

parameters.description: The ID of your global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

Description.description:
A description of the global network.

Length Constraints: Maximum length of 256 characters.

patch.description: Updates an existing global network. To remove information for any of the parameters, specify an empty string.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

get.description: Gets information about one or more of your connections in a global network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

ConnectedDeviceId.description: The ID of the second device in the connection.

ConnectedLinkId.description: The ID of the link for the second device.

Description.description:
A description of the connection.

Length Constraints: Maximum length of 256 characters.

DeviceId.description: The ID of the first device in the connection.

LinkId.description: The ID of the link for the first device.

Tags.description: The tags to apply to the resource during creation.

post.description: Creates a connection between two devices. The devices can be a physical or virtual appliance that connects to a third-party appliance in a VPC, or a physical appliance that connects to another physical appliance in an on-premises network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

parameters.description: The ID of the connection.
parameters.name: connectionId

delete.description: Deletes the specified connection in your global network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

parameters.description: The ID of the connection.
parameters.name: connectionId

ConnectedLinkId.description: The ID of the link for the second device in the connection.

Description.description:
A description of the connection.

Length Constraints: Maximum length of 256 characters.

LinkId.description: The ID of the link for the first device in the connection.

patch.description: Updates the information for an existing connection. To remove information for any of the parameters, specify an empty string.

get.description: Gets the association information for customer gateways that are associated with devices and links in your global network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

CustomerGatewayArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer gateway. For more information, see Resources Defined by Amazon EC2.

post.description:
Associates a customer gateway with a device and optionally, with a link. If you specify a link, it must be associated with the specified device.

You can only associate customer gateways that are connected to a VPN attachment on a transit gateway. The transit gateway must be registered in your global network. When you register a transit gateway, customer gateways that are connected to the transit gateway are automatically included in the global network. To list customer gateways that are connected to a transit gateway, use the DescribeVpnConnections EC2 API and filter by transit-gateway-id.

You cannot associate a customer gateway with more than one device and link.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer gateway. For more information, see Resources Defined by Amazon EC2.
parameters.name: customerGatewayArn

delete.description: Disassociates a customer gateway from a device and a link.

parameters.name: globalNetworkId

get.description: Gets the link associations for a device or a link. Either the device ID or the link ID must be specified.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

post.description: Associates a link to a device. A device can be associated to multiple links and a link can be associated to multiple devices. The device and link must be in the same global network and the same site.

get.description:
Gets information about one or more links in a specified global network.

If you specify the site ID, you cannot specify the type or provider in the same request. You can specify the type and provider in the same request.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

Upload speed in Mbps.

get.description: Gets information about one or more of your transit gateway Connect peer associations in a global network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

TransitGatewayConnectPeerArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Connect peer.

post.description:
Associates a transit gateway Connect peer with a device, and optionally, with a link. If you specify a link, it must be associated with the specified device.

You can only associate transit gateway Connect peers that have been created on a transit gateway that's registered in your global network.

You cannot associate a transit gateway Connect peer with more than one device and link.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the transit gateway Connect peer.
parameters.name: transitGatewayConnectPeerArn

delete.description: Disassociates a transit gateway Connect peer from a device and link.

parameters.name: globalNetworkId

get.description: Gets information about the transit gateway registrations in a specified global network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

TransitGatewayArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the transit gateway. For more information, see Resources Defined by Amazon EC2.

post.description: Registers a transit gateway in your global network. The transit gateway can be in any AWS Region, but it must be owned by the same AWS account that owns the global network. You cannot register a transit gateway in more than one global network.

parameters.description: The ID of the global network.
parameters.name: globalNetworkId

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the transit gateway.
parameters.name: transitGatewayArn

delete.description: Deregisters a transit gateway from your global network. This action does not delete your transit gateway, or modify any of its attachments. This action removes any customer gateway associations.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
parameters.name: resourceArn
